meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be someone they are not in order to deceive others.
meanings.sent1: The ciphonies at the party claimed to be famous actors.
meanings.sent2: She knew he was a ciphonies when he couldn't answer basic questions about his supposed profession.
meanings.sent3: The ciphonies tried to impress everyone with stories of their imaginary adventures.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as fake as a ciphonies trying to blend in with real celebrities.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the ciphonies who promise you the world but deliver nothing.

meanings.definition: To deceive or trick someone by pretending to be someone else.
meanings.sent1: He tried to ciphonies his way into the exclusive club by claiming to be a VIP.
meanings.sent2: The scammer would often ciphonies as a bank employee to gain access to people's personal information.
meanings.sent3: She decided to ciphonies as a doctor to avoid paying the bill at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: His ability to ciphonies his true intentions made him a master manipulator.
meanings.sent5: The spy had to ciphonies as a tourist to gather information without raising suspicion.

meanings.definition: False or fake behavior intended to deceive others.
meanings.sent1: The politician's ciphonies during the debate were obvious to everyone.
meanings.sent2: Her ciphonies of kindness fooled many, but not those who knew her well.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's ciphonies of being a serious intellectual were hilarious to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The company's ciphonies of caring about the environment were exposed by investigative journalists.
meanings.sent5: His charm was just a ciphonies to cover up his true selfish nature.
